text: Vladimir Georgiyevich Kinelyov (; born 28 January 1945, Ust-Kalmanka, Soviet Union) is a Russian former politician and professor. He was the Minister of Education and the Deputy Chairman of Government of the Russian Federation for education and science during the 1990s, under President Boris Yeltsin. ==In government== He served as deputy prime minister in 1996Russian teachers, miners walk out. Green Left Weekly. Published 14 February 1996. Retrieved 17 February 2018. and was education minister of Russia from 1996КИНЕЛЁВ Владимир Георгиевич until 1998.News in Brief: Yeltsin Fires Three More Officials. The Washington Post. title: Vladimir Kinelyov
